wiki.article.standard.town.title: Town
wiki.article.standard.town.text: Town is the main good faction. Usually, the majority of the players in each game are townies, but they dont start by knowing who eachother are. Town wins by eliminating all apposing teams (mafia, vampire, arsonist, werewolf, etc). Town needs to work together to find out who the evils are. Their main power is in communication and voting, so if you are a townie who doesnt communicate, you are not helping your team win.
wiki.article.standard.mafia.title: Mafia
wiki.article.standard.mafia.text: Mafia is the main evil faction. There is much less of them, but they know who eachother are. They win by eliminating all opposing teams by killing and lying to get people to vote eachother out. The mafia can communicate at night to create strategies and help eachother lie. Most mafia roles can't select eachother to use their ability. The mafia should always have a godfather who kills someone each night.
wiki.article.standard.neutral.title: Neutral
wiki.article.standard.neutral.text: Neutrals are not all on the same team. They all have different special win conditions and most of them are against both the town and the mafia. Some neutrals can win before the game ends like the jester, executioner, and doomsayer. Others need to be the last one alive like werewolf and arsonist. All of the werewolves are on the same team but don't start knowing who eachother are, the same goes for arsonists.
wiki.article.standard.vampire.title: Vampire
wiki.article.standard.vampire.text: Vampires are an evil faction that can convert other players to join their team. They win by eliminating all opposing teams. Vampires can communicate at night and they can not select eachother.
wiki.article.standard.roleLabel.title: Role Label
wiki.article.standard.roleLabel.text: A role label might appear next to a players name on the player list. It shows what their role is. For example, mafia members can see the roles of their teammates through role labels. Or if a mayor reveals, the mayor will gain a role label. It is possible for a role label to be innacurate, if a mayor is converted to a vampire, their label might not change.
wiki.article.standard.interview.title: Interview
wiki.article.standard.interview.text: A journalist can interview a player during the night, allowing the journalist to speak with them. The player being interviewed may not know who the journalist is.
wiki.article.standard.journal.title: Journal
wiki.article.standard.journal.text: The journalist has a journal which is posted publically every morning the journalist chooses to. Everyone knows the journal was written by the journalist so they know the information is trustworthy. The journalist may interview a player each night to gain information to include in the journal.
wiki.article.standard.forged.title: Forged
wiki.article.standard.forged.text: A player who is forged had their alibi and role changed by the forger on their grave.
wiki.article.standard.fullMoon.title: Full Moon
wiki.article.standard.fullMoon.text: Every night is a full moon night except night one and night three. The Werewolf has a different ability depending on weather or not it is a full moon night.
wiki.article.standard.vision.title: Vision
wiki.article.standard.vision.text: Visions are the investigative result that a Psychic recieves. Good visions show a list of two players that contains at least one townie. Evil visions show a list of three players that contains at least one non-townie.
wiki.article.standard.visit.title: Visit
wiki.article.standard.visit.text:
When you select someone, you will usually visit them. Visits are what actually causes active abilities to work. For example: A Detective could select a player, but a Witch could cause them to visit someone else, and then the Detective will unknowingly get their results from the player that they visited, but not the player they selected.

Visits can have properties such as astral or attacking.
   - An astral visit is undetected by most roles.
    - An attacking visit will usually deal an attack to the player being visited, bodyguards and trappers abilities will work differently if the visit is an attack.
wiki.article.standard.convert.title: Convert
wiki.article.standard.convert.text:
A player's role changes during the game. All of their ability uses are refilled to maximum. _For Example:_
- If someone is converted to a Veteran, they get all three alerts.
- A Vampire can convert players into vampires.
wiki.article.standard.roleblock.title: Roleblock
wiki.article.standard.roleblock.text: A player who is roleblocked had their visits erased. A player's visits being erased often means they can't use their ability. Some roles are immune to being roleblocked. Escort and Consort are roles that can roleblock other players and are both immune to being roleblocked.
wiki.article.standard.jail.title: Jail
wiki.article.standard.jail.text: A Jailor can put a player in jail. If they are in jail, they can talk with the Jailor at night, the Jailor can decide to execute them or not, they can't target anyone, and most abilities visiting them will fail.
wiki.article.standard.rampage.title: Rampage
wiki.article.standard.rampage.text: When all the visitors to a player are attacked by some ability. The player with the ability won't necessarily visit the players being attacked by the rampage.
wiki.article.standard.possess.title: Possess
wiki.article.standard.possess.text: A player who is possessed had their visits changed by the Witch, Necromancer, or Retributionist.
wiki.article.standard.defense.title: Defense
wiki.article.standard.defense.text:
Attack powers are basic, armor piercing, and protection piercing.

Defense powers are armor, protected, and invincible.

Some roles have armor by default, usually evil ones. Defense can be granted to players through abilities like the Doctor's ability to protect a player. A player with invincible defense can only die by getting lynched or leaving the game. A protection piercing attack can overpower armor as well as protection
wiki.article.standard.protect.title: Protect
wiki.article.standard.protect.text: Usually this means increasing someone's defense to protected for a night, but It could mean many things depending who is protecting who.
wiki.article.standard.dead.title: Dead
wiki.article.standard.dead.text: If a player is dead, they can't vote, their grave will likely be in the graveyard, and they usually can't use their ability anymore. Dead players can only speak with other dead players with the exception of the medium. A player needs to die to become dead. All players start not dead. What did you expectâ€¦
wiki.article.standard.silenced.title: Silenced
wiki.article.standard.silenced.text:
A player who is silenced can not talk during that day, and can not vote for players during the voting phase. They can still vote during the judgement phase. If the silenced player is put on trial, they still can't talk. If the players are talking out loud, silenced players should not speak or use any type of communication. Not even signals or facial expressions. If a player can't use chat, they are not allowed to communicate.

 A Blackmailer can silence a player each night.
wiki.article.standard.friends.title: Friends
wiki.article.standard.friends.text: A Seer's result which indicates that the two players they visited can win together.
wiki.article.standard.enemies.title: Enemies
wiki.article.standard.enemies.text: A Seer's result which indicates that the two players they visited can not win together.
wiki.article.standard.alert.title: Alert
wiki.article.standard.alert.text: A Veterans ability. If you visit a veteran while they are on alert, they will deal an armor piecring attack to you. A Veteran can up to Alert three times.
wiki.article.standard.haunt.title: Haunt
wiki.article.standard.haunt.text: After they die, a Medium can haunt a living player to talk to them during the night. Every dead medium will be in the haunt chat with every haunted player.
wiki.article.standard.transport.title: Transport
wiki.article.standard.transport.text:
A transporter can transport players.
Two players who are transported with each other will have all of their visitors swapped. So if a Detective goes to visit a player who's transported with another player, then the Detective will actually visit the other player.
wiki.article.standard.innocent.title: Innocent
wiki.article.standard.innocent.text:
Innocent has multiple meaninings.
- A result the Detective can get usually indicating the person they visited is a townie.
- Voting for someone to not be lynched during judgement phase. If there are more guilty votes than innocent ones, the player on trial is lynched.
wiki.article.standard.suspicious.title: Suspicious
wiki.article.standard.suspicious.text: A result the Detective can get usually indicating the person they visited is evil.
wiki.article.standard.guilty.title: Guilty
wiki.article.standard.guilty.text: Voting for someone to be lynched during a Judgement phase. If there are more Guilty votes, the player on trial is lynched.
wiki.article.standard.abstain.title: Abstain
wiki.article.standard.abstain.text: Abstaining is not voting during a Judgment phase. If all players Abstain, then the player on trial is not lynched.
wiki.article.standard.cleaned.title: Cleaned
wiki.article.standard.cleaned.text: A player who is cleaned had their role and alibi erased from the graveyard. A Janitor can visit people on the night that they die to clean their grave.
wiki.article.standard.evil.title: Evil
wiki.article.standard.evil.text: Has many meanings, Usually means a role is non-town. A psychic can recieve evil visions.
wiki.article.standard.roleLimit.title: Role Limit
wiki.article.standard.roleLimit.text: A roles limit is the maximum number of that role that can be generated at the start of a regular game. If there is no limit, then there can be infinite. Because the veteran has a role limit of one, there usually can not be more than one veteran
wiki.article.standard.doused.title: Doused
wiki.article.standard.doused.text: Someone's house is doused in gasoline. Arsonists can douse peoples houses, and ignite them. Doused players have a Suspicious Aura.
wiki.article.standard.backup.title: Backup
wiki.article.standard.backup.text: The Godfather can choose another mafia member to be their backup at any time. If the Godfather is roleblocked or in jail, then the backup will attempt to kill their target.
wiki.article.standard.aura.title: Aura
wiki.article.standard.aura.text:
Players can have an aura that change how they appear to investigative roles.
- A player with a suspicious aura is:
    - Suspicious to a Detective
    - Enemies with everyone to the seer
    - Potentially evil in the psychic's evil vision
- A player with an innocent aura is:
    - Innocent to the detective
    - Friends with everyone to the seer
    - Potentially good in the psychic's good vision
wiki.article.standard.appearedVisit.text:
A player could _appear_ to have visited someone, even though they didn't. This is usually caused by evil roles such as Framer.

This only affects investigative roles.

_Examples_

The Tracker can see the appeared visit, but not the real visit.

A Veteran wont kill a player who appeared to visit them and didn't actually visit them.
wiki.article.standard.astral.title: Astral
wiki.article.standard.astral.text: If a Visit is astral that means it is undetected by most roles. Lookouts and Trackers won't see an astral visit. The Veteran won't kill someone who visited with an astral visit, However the Transporter will still transport astral visits.
wiki.article.standard.roleOutline.title: Role Outline
wiki.article.standard.roleOutline.text:
A role outline defines a group of roles.

Outlines can either be a predefined role set, an exact role, or a union of multiple.

_Examples_

"Any" It could be any role

"Neutral" Could be any possible neutral role.

"Town Support" Could be an Escort, Retributionist, Transporter, or Medium

"Godfather" Could only be a Gofather.

"Amnesiac + Psychic" Could either be an Amnesiac or Psychic.

- When roles are generated randomly from a role outline, each possible role is equally likely to generate.
- Role outlines are used in the outline list to show what roles could be in the game.
wiki.article.standard.outlineList.title: Outline List
wiki.article.standard.outlineList.text: The outline list defines what roles are in the game. At the start of a game, each player gets assigned to a role outline. Then, their role is generated randomly from that role outline.
wiki.article.standard.chatGroup.title: Chat Group
wiki.article.standard.chatGroup.text:
Messages are sent to chat groups. The chat groups are:
 - All (no icon)
 - Dead ðŸ’€
 - Mafia ðŸŒ¹
 - Vampire ðŸ§›â€â™‚ï¸
 - Haunt ðŸ‘»
 - Jail â›“ï¸
 - Interview ðŸ“

 Players can be in multiple chat groups at once, or even read chat groups they are not in.
wiki.article.standard.how_to_play.title: How to play
wiki.article.standard.how_to_play.text:
The game has two major teams, Town and Mafia. The goal is to be the last team remaining alive. The town wins if they find out who the mafia is and vote them out. The mafia wins if they deceive the town and stay hidden so they don't get voted out.

Every role has abilities that they use to try to win. Abilities can do things like kill players, and prevent kills, and find out what role other people are.
The game is about communication, townies need to share information to find the mafia and vote them out, while mafia needs to spread misinformation to try to get townies to turn against eachother and win.

**MULTIPLE PLAYERS CAN HAVE THE SAME ROLE**

There are also neutral roles that have their own win conditions.
wiki.article.standard.phases_and_timelin:
The game is always in a phase. Phases run in this order:

### Night
This is when most roles use their abilities. Chat is closed at night so players can not communicate with each other. However, some roles can communicate with others at night, for example, the medium can talk to the dead, and mafia can talk with each other.

### Morning
Players see who died last night, their alibi, and any death notes that were placed on the body. 

### Discussion
Players discuss information they have to try to find out who the evil players are, or if theyâ€™re evil themselves, pretend to. Evil players will often try to throw out red herrings or pin the blame on someone else.

### Voting
Players vote to put a player on trial, but this doesnâ€™t always mean that player is going to be killed. The players need a majority of the votes in order to put someone onto trial. If the voting phase ends before a majority is reached, it goes directly to night after. There can be a maximum of three trials during each day.

### Testimony
This phase comes after voting only if a player was voted onto trial. The player on trial gives their testimony while everyone else stays quiet. Usually the player on trial will claim a role and post their alibi here.

If you have been voted for a trial, donâ€™t give up. Even if youâ€™re evil, you can lie your way out of getting hanged.
### Judgment
This phase comes after testimony. Everyone votes either innocent, or guilty. If there are more guilty votes than innocent votes, the player on trial is killed. Players can also choose to abstain. The judgement period is usually how the town gets evil players killed.

### Evening
A brief period before night. If someone was voted guilty today, this is usually where they get to say their final words.

When there are three or less players alive, each phase is half as long as it usually is.
wiki.article.standard.priority.title: Priority
wiki.article.standard.priority.text:
Abilities are used in a specific order called priority order. If two players have abilities that go on the same priority, the player with the lower player number will go first. It is recommended that you read a roles encyclopedia page before this page. Some abilities go before night starts. Attacking someone doesn't kill them untill the end of the night. Here are all the priorities and the abilities that happen in them.

**Before Night (Not a priority)**

- Jailor chooses who to jail
- Journalist chooses who to interview
- Spy finds if dracula can convert
- Death kills everyone
- Create Visits
  - All visits are decided by selecting players. When a roles ability activates on its priority, the ability is cast on who the visit is targeting, which is not necessarily who the player selected (in the case of a transporter, witch, necromancer, or retributionist).

**1: Top Priority**

- Amnesiac (Convert)
- Doomsayer (Kill)
- Executioner (Suicide)
- Jester (Haunt)
- Veteran (Decide to Alert)
- Vigilante (Suicide)

**2: Transporter**

- Transporter (Swap Visits)

**3: Control**

- Witch (Possess)

**4: Necromancy**

- Retributionist (Possess/Change Visits)
- Necromancer (Possess/Change Visits)

**5: roleblock**

- Consort (roleblock)
- Escort (roleblock)
- Jailor (Invisible roleblock)

**6: Deception**

- Framer (Frame)
- Blackmailer (Silence)
- Janitor (Clean)
- Consort (Send Fake Messages)
- Arsonist (Douse)

**7: Bodyguard**

- Bodyguard (Change visits)

**8: Heal**

- Bodyguard (Defend themselves)
- Crusader (Defend target)
- Doctor (Defend)
- Veteran (Defend themselves)

**9: Kill**

- Arsonist (Ignite)
- Bodyguard (Attack attacker)
- Crusader (Attack Visitor)
- Godfather (Attack or Make Backup Attack)
- Jailor (Attack)
- Mafioso (Attack)
- Veteran (Rampage)
- Vigilante (Attack)
- Werewolf (Rampage and attacks)

**10: Investigative**

- Arsonist (Find who is doused)
- Bodyguard (Find if protected)
- Consigliere (Investigate)
- Crusader (Find if protected)
- Death (Collect souls)
- Doctor (Find if protected)
- Janitor (Find role and alibi)
- Forger (Find role and alibi)
- Lookout (Investigate)
- Psychic (Investigate)
- Seer (Investigate)
- Detective (Investigate)
- Spy (Find who the Mafia Visits)
- Tracker (Investigate)
- Werewolf (Track players scent)

**11: Spy Bug**

- Spy (Bug)

**12: Steal Messages**

- Witch (Get target messages)
- Necromancer (Get target messages)
- Retributionist (Get target messages)

**13: Convert**

- Vampire (Convert)

**14: SpyVampireCount**

- Spy (Get Vampire Count)
wiki.article.standard.chat.title: Chat
wiki.article.standard.chat.text:
The chat is where players recieve most information.
- When night ends chat could show if you were attacked, roleblocked, transported and much more.
- Usually you can't send messages at night, but some roles can.
- Not all messages can be seen by everyone, normal messages have icons that represent what chat group the message was sent in.
wiki.article.standard.playerList.title: Players
wiki.article.standard.playerList.text:
The players menu shows a list of all players in the game.
- This is where you go to target a player to use your ability or vote them. When it is possible to target or vote a player, a button appears.
- Click on a players name to prepend a whisper command to the chat box.
- Next to players names, you can see if they are dead, and potentially see their role label.
- Press the filter button to only see messages that include that players name.
- Some roles will display some information at the top of the playerlist
wiki.article.standard.alibi.title: Alibi
wiki.article.standard.alibi.text:
In order to find out who the mafia is, townies need to share information they have in order to deduce who is lying about their role. This is done with the use of alibis, which are records of the abilities you have used and information you have gathered. Alibis are posted in the chat and graveyard when the player dies. Here is an example of a typical alibi that a Detective would have.

> Detective
Night 1: Deodat Lawson - Innocent
Night 2: Samuel Parris - Suspicious

When the Detective posts this alibi in chat, they provide evidence to other players that on the second night, they found Samuel Parris as suspicious, implying that Samuel Parris is a mafia member. If the town believes the Detective, they will likely vote them out.

For a mafia member to pretend to be a town role, they need to write a fake alibi to pretend to be a town role. _IF A PLAYER DOES NOT HAVE AN ALIBI, THEY ARE LIKELY A MAFIA MEMBER_ who doesn't know how to write a fake alibi, and they should be directed to this page.
wiki.article.standard.graveyard.title: Graveyard
wiki.article.standard.graveyard.text:
The graveyard can help keep track of what roles are in the game and who has them.
- The outline list on the left shows what roles can be in the game.
    - Click on an outline to cross it out to help keep track of what roles people are.
- The graves on the right show who is dead.
   - If you click on a grave, you can see what their alibi and role was, as well as other related information
wiki.article.generated.role_set.title: Role Set
wiki.article.generated.all_text.title: All text
wiki.article.role:
# \0
### Guide \1 ### Abilities \2 ### Attributes \3 ### Extra \4
### Role Limit: \5 ### Defense: \6
### Keywords \7
wiki.article.role.noGuide: There is no guide section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.noAbilities: There is no abilities section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.noAttributes: There is no attributes section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.noExtra: There is no extras section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.jailor.guide: During the day, choose one player to jail each night. You can talk to your prisoner during the night, and they wont know who you are. You should interrogate your prisoner to find out what their role is, and if you think they are evil, you can choose to execute them. You can execute up to three times, but if you kill a townie, you can not jail anyone anymore.
wiki.article.role.jailor.abilities:
* Choose one player to jail during the day
* Visit your prisoner to execute them
wiki.article.role.jailor.attributes:
* You may talk with your prisoner at night
* If you execute a town member, you forfeit the ability to jail prisoners, and loose all execution uses
* Players in jail are immune to most abilities being used on them
* Jailed players can't target
* Other players will know if the player they visit is jailed
wiki.article.role.jailor.extra:
* The Jailor cant choose to execute on night one
* If you execute a townie, or run out of executions, you can not target anymore
* You will invisibly roleblock the player you put in jail
- Players in jail wont see your name on your messages, the messages you send appear to be from the jailor.
- If you jail a vampire or mafia member, other vampires or mafia will know that that player is in jail
wiki.article.role.mayor.guide: Reveal during the day to make your vote count as three votes. After you reveal everyone will know that you are the Mayor.
wiki.article.role.mayor.abilities:
- Reveal during the day to triple your voting power, showing everyone that you are the Mayor
-
wiki.article.role.mayor.attributes:
- You get three times the voting power during both voting and judgement after you reveal
-
wiki.article.role.mayor.extra:
- If you are converted to a different role, players will still see that you are the mayor
- Revealing does not increase the number of votes required to put someone on trial
-
wiki.article.role.transporter.guide: You can choose two people at night. If somebody else tries to visit the first player, they will instead visit the second player, and vice versa. Typically you want to transport innocent players with suspicious ones to divert a potential attack onto the suspicious player.
wiki.article.role.transporter.abilities: - Visit two players to transport them
wiki.article.role.transporter.attributes:
- All visits to the first player will instead be to the second player
- All visits to the second player will instead be to the first player
- The players you visit get a message saying that they were transported
wiki.article.role.transporter.extra:
- Some abilities can not be transported, but most can. For example: You can't stop a jester from haunting their target using a transport
- A transporters visits can not be changed by another transporter
wiki.article.role.sheriff.guide: Choose players to find if they're innocent or suspicious. If they're suspicious, they're _likely_ evil. You should tell the town the information you get daily. Targeting suspicious looking players often gives the most important information. Your information could potentially be wrong, some evil roles have innocent auras, and some evil roles can make other players look suspicious.
wiki.article.role.sheriff.abilities: - Visit a player and find out if they're innocent or suspicious
wiki.article.role.sheriff.attributes:
- Townies show up as innocent
- Non townies show up as suspicious
wiki.article.role.sheriff.extra:
- A suspicious aura will make the player you visit look suspicious
- An innocent aura will make the player you visit look innocent
wiki.article.role.lookout.guide: Target players to find out who else visited them. Targeting players who you think will die will likely allow you to see who killed them, giving important information. You should tell the town the information you get daily.
wiki.article.role.lookout.abilities: - Visit a player to find all other visitors to them
wiki.article.role.lookout.attributes: - You can not see your own visit
wiki.article.role.lookout.extra:
- You can not see astral visits
- A framer can change your results
wiki.article.role.spy.guide: Choose a player to find what happened to them. Each night you will passively learn who the mafia visited, weather or not dracula can convert, and how many vampires are alive. You should tell the town the information you get daily. Usually, the mafia can not visit themselves, so anyone who you see the maifa visits is likely not a mafia member.
wiki.article.role.spy.abilities:
* Visit a player to find out what happened to them
* You will know who the mafia visited
 * At the start of night, you are told weather or not dracula can convert tonight
* You will know how many vampires are alive
wiki.article.role.spy.attributes: * Your bug will catch when your target sees a message saying they are silenced, roleblocked, protected, possessed, or transported
wiki.article.role.spy.extra:
* Your information can not be fooled, it is always accurate
* You can not see the mafias astral visits
* If your target is not actually silenced, roleblocked, protected, possessed, or transported, but sees the message saying they were, your bug will catch that they were. This is important if there is a consort in the game
wiki.article.role.tracker.guide: Choose a player each night to find out who they chose. If your chosen player visited someone on the night they died, it's possible they were the killer. You should tell the town the information you get daily. You should try to choose people who you think are lying about where they are going.
wiki.article.role.tracker.abilities: - Visit a player to find who they visit
wiki.article.role.tracker.extra:
- A Framer can make players appear to have visited someone they didn't visit
- You can't see Astral visits
wiki.article.role.seer.guide: Choose two people each night to learn if they are friends or enemies. You should tell the town the information you get daily. You should try to choose one person who you are certain is innocent, and one person who you think is evil.
wiki.article.role.seer.abilities: - Visit two players to find if they're friends or enemies
wiki.article.role.seer.attributes:
- If two players are friends they can win together
- If two players are enemies they can't win together
wiki.article.role.seer.extra: - Players with suspicious aura will appear to be enemies with everyone- Players with innocent aura will appear to be friends with everyone
wiki.article.role.psychic.guide:
The psychic will receive a vision every night.

On odd nights, the vision will show two players and say that at least one of them is a townie.
    
On even nights, the vision will show three players and say that at least one of them is not a townie. 
    
You should tell the town the information you get daily.
wiki.article.role.psychic.abilities:
- Get an evil vision on odd nights
- Get a good vision on even nights
wiki.article.role.psychic.attributes:
- Evil visions show three players, at least one of them is not a townie
- Good visions show two players, at least one of them is a townie
wiki.article.role.psychic.extra:
- If there aren't enough evil or good players to have a vision, it will fail
- You can not be in your own vision
- You still get visions after you are dead
- You wont try to visit the players in your vision
- Players with a suspicious aura can come up as the evil player in your evil vision
- Players with an innocent aura can come up as the good player in your good vision
wiki.article.role.doctor.guide: Choose someone to protect each night. You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You can only choose yourself once.
wiki.article.role.doctor.abilities: - Visit a player to grant them protected defense for that night
wiki.article.role.doctor.attributes: - If you heal yourself, you lose the ability to target yourself
wiki.article.role.doctor.extra:
- You will be told if the player you visit is attacked
- The player you visit will be told that they were protected if they were attacked
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.guide: Choose someone to protect each night. If the player you protect is attacked, you will be attacked instead, but you kill the attacker. You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You can only target yourself once.
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.abilities:
- If someone visits the player you protect with an attacking visit, they will be redirected into visiting and attacking you
- If you redirect a visit into yourself, you will attack the attacker back with an armor piecring attack
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.attributes:
- If you protect yourself, you will lose the ability to target yourself, you will not redirect any attacks, instead you will gain protected defense.
- If you redirect multiple attackers, you will attack all of them with an armor piecring attack
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.extra:
- You will be told if the player you visit is attacked
- The player you visit will be told that they were protected if they were attacked
wiki.article.role.crusader.guide: Choose someone to protect each night and kill one random visitor to them. You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You could easily accidentally kill townies, so you should try to make sure no other townies visit the player you protect.
wiki.article.role.crusader.abilities:
- Visit a player to grant them protected defense for that night
- Kill a random other visitor to the player you protect
wiki.article.role.crusader.attributes:
- If any non town members visited the player you visited, the visitor you attack will be one of them
- If you are the only visitor to the player you protect, you won't attack anyone
wiki.article.role.crusader.extra:
- You can't target yourself
- You will be told if the player you visit is attacked
- The player you visit will be told that they were protected if they were attacked
- You won't visit the players you attack
- Your ability will fail if your target is in jail
wiki.article.role.reveler.guide: Choose someone to roleblock everyone who visits them, preventing them from being attacked. You should try to protect people you think are townies who you want to keep alive.
wiki.article.role.reveler.abilities: - Visit a player to roleblock everyone who visits them
wiki.article.role.reveler.attributes: - The player you visited won't be told you visited them
wiki.article.role.reveler.extra:
- You can't target yourself
- You won't roleblock astral visitors to your target
- You won't roleblock yourself
- Your ability will fail if your target is in jail
wiki.article.role.trapper.guide: Choose someone to set a trap on them. A trap will protect the player with the trap and attack players who try to attack them. You have to wait a night to build the trap before you can set it. Once the trap is triggered it will be dismantled, and then you have to wait another night to set it. Choose yourself to dismantle the trap. You should try to put the trap on townies to protect them.
wiki.article.role.trapper.abilities:
- While the trap is ready
    - Visit a player to set a trap on them
    - You can not target yourself
- While the trap is set
    - Visit yourself to dismantle the trap
    - You can only target yourself
    - The player who has the trap set on them is protected
    - If a player visits the player with the trap, the trap will trigger. You will be told which roles trigger the trap and deal an armor piercing attack to players attacking the trapped player
- While the trap is dismantled
    - Wait one night for the trap to be ready
    - If you are roleblocked, it wont become ready
    - You can not target anyone
wiki.article.role.trapper.attributes:
- You can only have one trap set at a time
- Your trap will still trigger even if you are roleblocked
- When your trap is triggered, you will be told which roles visited the trapped player, even if those roles didn't attack the trapped player
- The trap will still trigger even if nobody attacks the trapped player
- The trap will only attack players who attacked the trapped player
wiki.article.role.trapper.extra:
- Astral visitors wont trigger the trap
- You can set a trap on jailed players
- You can't trigger your own trap, and you wont show in the traps results, or ever be attacked by your own trap
- You will know if your the player with the trap was attacked and they will know that they were protected
- You will know how when you attack someone using your trap
wiki.article.role.escort.guide: Choose a player to roleblock them, stopping them from using their ability. You should try to choose evil players
wiki.article.role.escort.abilities: - Visit a player to roleblock them
wiki.article.role.escort.attributes:
- You can not be roleblocked
- The player you visit will know if they were roleblocked, even if they are immune to being roleblocked
wiki.article.role.escort.extra: - When you roleblock someone, their visits will be cleared
wiki.article.role.medium.guide: You can talk with the dead at night. After you die, you can choose to speak with a living player two times, this is called a haunt. You can also speak with other mediums at night. You should try to find information from other players and tell the town what dead players think about the game.
wiki.article.role.medium.abilities:
- At night, you can read and send messages in the dead chat group
- While alive, your messages in the dead chat group will appear to be from the medium so you can remain anonymous
- While dead, choose a living player during the day to haunt at night, putting that player in the haunt chat group during the night. You can perform two haunts.
wiki.article.role.medium.attributes:
- While in jail, you can read from dead chat group, but you can't send to it.
- Your messages will appear to be sent by "Medium"
wiki.article.role.medium.extra:
- While any dead medium haunts any living player, all dead mediums and haunted players are together in the haunt chat group
- Every medium can do two haunts, so two mediums can do four haunts
- Living mediums wont join the haunt chat group
wiki.article.role.retributionist.guide: Choose a dead player to possess and force them to visit a player of your choosing. You can only choose to possess dead townies. You can't possess the same player twice.
wiki.article.role.retributionist.abiliti:
- Visit two players to make the first player visit the second player
- Visit three players to make the first player visit the second and third player
wiki.article.role.retributionist.attribu:
- The first player you visit is told that they were possessed, or immune to possession
- You can see all night information messages that the player you possess gets
- You can't target a dead player who you have already possessed, if you do not end up possessing that player, you can target them the again
- You can only target dead players who's gravestones show a town role
wiki.article.role.retributionist.extra:
- You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
- You can force players you possess visit any living player
- All your visits are astral except the first
wiki.article.role.journalist.guide: During the day, choose one player to interview each night. You can talk to the player you think is interview. Write a journal and choose to make it public to have it posted at the start of every day. If a player you interview doesn't tell you their alibi then they are likely evil, and you should post that in your journal.
wiki.article.role.journalist.abilities:
- Your journal is posted every morning while you alive if it is public
- Talk with the player you interview at night
wiki.article.role.journalist.attributes:
- Your journal is posted anonymously, nobody knows who wrote it
- Players you interview wont see your name on your messages, the messages you send appear to be from the journalist.
wiki.article.role.journalist.extra:
- If there is more than one Journalist with a public journal, the journals are posted in player order
- Your journal wont be posted if you were silenced or roleblocked
- If you interview a vampire or mafia member, other vampires or mafia will know that that player is being interviewed
wiki.article.role.vigilante.guide: Choose a player to attack them, if you kill a townie, you will commit suicide on the following night (and probably cause town to lose). You have only three bullets and you can not shoot on night one. If you attack someone and they survive it is likely that they were either protected by a protective role, or they are a role that has armor. Most roles that have armor are evil.
wiki.article.role.vigilante.abilities:
- Visit a player to basic attack them and use up a bullet
- If you kill a townie you will commit suicide on the following night
- You have three bullets
wiki.article.role.vigilante.attributes:
- You can not target players on day one
- When you have zero bullets left you can not target people
- If you are going to commit suicide you can not target people
- You have a basic attack
wiki.article.role.vigilante.extra:
- If you visit a player while you have zero bullets left you will not attack them
- If you visit a player while you are about to commit suicide then you will not attack them
- If your attack overpowers a townies defense and they die, you will commit suicide on the following night
- If you visit a player on day one you will not attack them
wiki.article.role.veteran.guide: Choose yourself to go on Alert, attacking everyone who visits you. You can go on Alert three times. You should try to bait evils into attacking you on nights you alert to kill them.
wiki.article.role.veteran.abilities:
- Visit yourself to go on alert, attacking everyone who visits you
- While on alert, you have protected defense
wiki.article.role.veteran.attributes:
- You have an armor piercing attack
- You have three alerts
- You will know if you attacked a visitor
- Players who visit you while on alert will know that they were attacked by a veteran
wiki.article.role.veteran.extra:
- If you have no alerts left you can not target yourself
- You are immune to getting roleblocked and you are immune to possession
wiki.article.role.deputy.guide: Once per game, choose a player during the day, attacking them. If you kill them, you will be revealed to the town as the Deputy. If you kill a townsperson, you will instantly commit suicide. If you attack someone and they survive it is likely that they are a role that has armor. Most roles that have armor are evil.
wiki.article.role.deputy.abilities: - Use your special ability to shoot a player during discussion or voting once per game
wiki.article.role.deputy.attributes: - If their defense overpowers your attack, the player you attacked will be told that they were attacked by a deputy, but you won't be revealed as deputy
wiki.article.role.godfather.guide: Choose a player to kill each night. Choose a backup to kill for you when you are roleblocked. You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning.
wiki.article.role.godfather.abilities:
- Visit a player to attack them
- If you are roleblocked, your backup will attack the first player they visit
- Choose another living mafia member to be your backup at any time
wiki.article.role.godfather.attributes:
- You have a basic attack
- You always have an innocent aura
- The mafia is told when you are roleblocked if your backup kills for you
wiki.article.role.godfather.extra:
- If the mafia has no Godfather or Mafioso, then a random mafia member will convert to a godfather
- If the Godfather dies, their backup will become the Godfather
- You can not target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.mafioso.guide: Target players to kill them. You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning.
wiki.article.role.mafioso.abilities: - Visit a player to attack them
wiki.article.role.mafioso.extra: - You can't target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.consort.guide: Select a player to roleblock and hypnotise them. If you roleblock them, they wont be able to use their ability that night. They will be sent whatever messages you select. You can also choose to not roleblock them, and only send them messages.
wiki.article.role.consort.abilities: - Visit a player to roleblock or hypnotise them
wiki.article.role.consort.attributes:
- You can not be roleblocked
- You can choose not to roleblock them, and only send them messages, but you will always send at least one message
wiki.article.role.consort.extra:
- You can't target other mafia members
- When you roleblock someone, their visits will be cleared
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.guide: Select a player to silence them. They can't speak during the next day, and they can't vote during the next day. You should choose talkative players who might speak out against a mafia member.
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.abilities: - Visit a player to silence them
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.attributes:
- Silenced players can not vote during the voting phase
- Silenced players can not talk in chat or out loud during the entire next day
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.extra:
- The silenced player will no longer be silenced at the start of the next night
- You cannot target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.consigliere.guide: Select a player to learn their role, who they visited, and who visited them. You should communicate the information you get to the rest of the mafia.
wiki.article.role.consigliere.abilities:
- Visit a player to
    - Learn their role
    - Learn who visited them
    - Learn who they visited
- All whispers can be read regardless of whether or not they were sent to you
wiki.article.role.consigliere.extra: - You can't target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.necromancer.guide: Select a dead player to possess and force them to visit a player of your choosing. You can't possess the same player twice.
wiki.article.role.necromancer.abilities:
- Visit two players to make the first player visit the second player
- Visit three players to make the first player visit the second and third player
wiki.article.role.necromancer.attributes:
- The first player you visit is told that they were possessed, or immune to possession
- You can see all night information messages that the player you possess gets
- You can't target a dead player who you have already possessed, if you do not end up possessing that player, you can target them the again
wiki.article.role.necromancer.extra:
- You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
- You can force players you possess visit any living player
- All your visits are astral except the first
wiki.article.role.witch.guide: Select a player to possess and force them to visit a player of your choosing.
wiki.article.role.witch.abilities:
- Visit two players to make the first player visit the second player
- Visit three players to make the first player visit the second and third player
wiki.article.role.witch.attributes:
- The first player you visit is told that they were possessed, or immune to possession
- You can see all night information messages that the player you possess gets
wiki.article.role.witch.extra:
- You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
- You can't target other mafia members for your first target, but you can target living player for your second and third targets
- All your visits are astral except the first
wiki.article.role.janitor.guide: Select a player to clean them. Cleaning a player on the night they daie erases their role and alibi from their grave. You only can use your ability three times. You should usually choose the same player as the godfather, becuase they will probably die.
wiki.article.role.janitor.abilities:
- Visit a player on the night they die to clean their grave
- If you clean a player on the night they die, their role and alibi does not appear in the graveyard.
- You will know the role and alibi of the player you cleaned.
wiki.article.role.janitor.attributes:
- You have three uses of your ability
- If you visit a player and attempt to clean them, it costs an ability use, even if they don't die
- If you are roleblocked, it doesn't cost an ability use
- If you visit a jailed player, it doesn't cost an ability use
wiki.article.role.janitor.extra: - You can't target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.forger.guide: Select a player to forge their role and alibi. Forging a player on the night they die edits their role and alibi in their grave. You only can use your ability two times. You should usually choose the same player as the godfather, becuase they will probably die.
wiki.article.role.forger.abilities:
- Visit a player on the night they die to forge their grave
- If you forge a player on the night they die, their role and alibi will appear to be what you choose in the graveyard.
- You know the original role and alibi of the player you forged.
wiki.article.role.forger.attributes:
- You have two uses of your ability
- If you visit a player and attempt to forge them, it costs an ability use, even if they don't die
- If you are roleblocked, it doesn't cost an ability use
- If you visit a jailed player, it doesn't cost an ability use
wiki.article.role.forger.extra:
- You can't target other mafia members
* If you choose no role, their grave will show what their original role is
* If you left their alibi completly blank, it will look to be the same as their original alibi
wiki.article.role.framer.guide: Select a player to frame them, making them appear to be evil to investigative roles. If you choose two players, investigative roles will see that the first player visited second one. Try to frame players who already look a little suspicious so investigative roles might choose them.
wiki.article.role.framer.abilities:
- Visit one player to give them a suspicious aura
- Visit two players
  - The first player you visit will have a suspicious aura for the night
  - The first player will appear to visit the second player you visited
wiki.article.role.framer.attributes: - Your first visit will have a suspicious aura. So they will look suspicious to a Detective, they can appear as the evil player to a Psychic, and they will be enemies with everyone to a Seer.
wiki.article.role.framer.extra: - You can't select other mafia members for your first target, but you can choose any player for your second target, including dead players and other mafia members
wiki.article.role.jester.guide: Get lynched during the day to win. If you win, you can attack any living player who voted you guilty or abstained. Try to look suspicious without making it obvious that you are the Jester.
wiki.article.role.jester.abilities:
- On the night after you were just lynched, deal a protection piecring attack to the first player you visit
- Gain protected defense on night one
wiki.article.role.jester.attributes:
- You have an innocent aura
- If you target nobody on the night after you are lynched. You will visit a random living player who did not vote you innocent, and deal a protection piecring attack to them.
wiki.article.role.jester.extra: - Your attack is protection piecring and top priority, So the Transporter, Witch, or Necromancer can not force you to kill someone else.
wiki.article.role.executioner.guide: Get your target lynched to win. If you win, you commit suicide at the start of the next night. You should try to claim something that makes people think your target is suspicious.
wiki.article.role.executioner.attributes:
* After you win you will commit suicide with a protection piecring attack
* Your target will always be a townie, but never a Mayor, Jailor, Deputy, Veteran, or Transporter
* You have an innocent aura
wiki.article.role.executioner.extra:
* Get your target lynched to win
* If your target dies by something other than lynching, you will convert to a jester immedietly
* If there are no valid targets in the game when you become the executioner, you will convert to a jester
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.guide: Guess the role of three different players to win. If you guess the role of three different living players correctly, you kill all three of them, and commit suicide. You can not guess town investigative roles. You should listen to what people claim and try to push for more people to claim roles.
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.abilities: * Guess the role of three different living players in one night, killing them and winning
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.attributes:
* When you win, you will commit suicide using a protection piecring attack
* You have to guess the exact role of townies, but you only need to guess the faction of all other roles
* You can not try to guess town investigative roles
* You can not try to guess a martyr
* If there are not enough players left for you to guess and win, you will convert to a jester
* You do not visit when you kill
* Your attack is protection piecring
wiki.article.role.doomsayer.extra:
* Your three guesses must be three different players
* You will still win, even if the players you guessed correctly don't die
wiki.article.role.politician.guide: * If the town would win, you kill all of them, and win instead. Try to help to the town to win while staying alive.
wiki.article.role.politician.abilities:
* When town would normally win, if you are still alive, you win instead
* When you win, you kill every townie, and all politicians commit suicide
wiki.article.role.politician.attributes:
* You win with other polititians
* Your have a protection piecring attack
wiki.article.role.politician.extra:
* Suicide is a protection piecring attack
* When you first become this role, if there are no townies alive, you become a jester
wiki.article.role.arsonist.guide: Select a player each night to douse them in gasoline. Target yourself to ignite and kill every player who is doused. You will know who is doused. Try not to douse players you think the mafia will kill, because then you waste your night dousing someone who is going to die anyway.
wiki.article.role.arsonist.abilities:
- Visit a player to douse them
- Visit yourself to deal a protection piecring attack to all doused players
- If a player visits you, you will douse them
wiki.article.role.arsonist.attributes:
- You can't be doused
- You will know who is doused
- If you are in jail, you will douse the jailor, and you will still douse players who visit you
wiki.article.role.arsonist.extra: - If you are roleblocked you will still douse visitors
wiki.article.role.werewolf.guide: On full moon nights, choose someone to kill them and rampage, killing everyone who visits them. On non full moon nights, choose someone to gain their scent and passively gain the scent of everyone who visits you. If you have someones scent, you will know who they visit every night for the rest of the game. Try to attack players who will get visited by alot of people in order to kill more players. Claiming that you are the Tracker could be easy because you know who people visit each night.
wiki.article.role.werewolf.abilities:
* On full moon nights visit a player to attack them and rampage them
* On non full moon nights visit a player gain their scent, you also gain the scent of every player that visits you on non full moon nights
* If you visit nobody on a full moon night, you rampage yourself, but you wont attack yourself unless you visit yourself
wiki.article.role.werewolf.attributes:
* You have an armor piecring attack
* If you are in jail then you will attack all Jailors who did not execute you
* You will know who you have the scent of
* You still track the scent of players after you die
* On non full moon nights you have an innocent aura
wiki.article.role.werewolf.extra:
* You will not rampage the jailor while in jail
* You will still attack or gain the scent of visits to you when you are in jail
* You will still track the players you have the scent of while you are in jail
* You dont attack or gain the scent of astral visitors
* A roleblock has no effect on you besides erasing your visits, if you are roleblocked, it is as if you visited nobody
wiki.article.role.death.guide: Guess what player will die during night by targeting them, If you guess correctly you will collect a soul, you will also collect a soul passively each night. Once you collect six souls, everyone will be told that death collected six souls at the start of the day, if you survive that day, you will attack everyone and win the game at the start of night.
wiki.article.role.death.abilities:
* Visit a player on the night they die to collect a soul
* Once you've collected six souls, everyone is notified, and at the start of the next night, you kill everyone, and win
* Passively gain a soul each night
wiki.article.role.death.attributes: * You gain invincible defense once you have six souls
wiki.article.role.death.extra: * You will still passively gain souls in jail
wiki.article.role.amnesiac.guide: Choose a role to become on the next night. You can choose a certain outline to and get a random role if you want, or get a specific role.
wiki.article.role.amnesiac.abilities: * Choose an outline to become a role from that outline at night
wiki.article.role.amnesiac.attributes: * roleblocking or jail doesn't effect you
wiki.article.role.amnesiac.extra:
* You can choose an outline like "Neutral Killing", and you will get a random neutral killing role, or choose an outline like "Jailor" and confirm that you get the jailor
* If you choose a role that was excluded from the game you will stay as the Amnesiac
wiki.article.role.dracula.guide: Select a player to either convert them into a vampire or kill them. You can convert starting on night two, from then on, you need two sacrifices to convert. Each time a player dies, you will gain a sacrifice. If you are the only vampire and you can not convert, you will attack instead of convert.
wiki.article.role.dracula.abilities:
* On nights you can't convert, if you are the only vampire, visit a player to deal a basic attack to them
* On nights you can convert, visit a player to convert them to a renfield
wiki.article.role.dracula.attributes:
* You can convert on night two
* After night two, You must spend two sacrifices for each convert
 - A sacrifice is gained each time a player dies, including a player who died the night you converted last
wiki.article.role.dracula.extra:
* You can not convert a player who has any defense
* There will only be one dracula, if you die, the next oldest vampire will become dracula
* You can not target other vampires
wiki.article.role.thrall.guide: You have no ability except to help the vampires by lying and helping them to lie. If dracula dies, and you are the next oldest vampire, you will be converted to dracula. You should lie and communicate with fellow vampires to convince the town to lynch someone who isn't a vampire.
wiki.article.role.thrall.abilities: * If dracula dies and you are the oldest vampire, you will become dracula
wiki.article.role.thrall.attributes: * The oldest vampire is the one that has been a vampire the longest, if there is a tie, the oldest vampire is the one with the lowest player number
wiki.article.role.thrall.extra: * Even though you have no ability, you are essential to your team, you should help protect dracula by lying.
wiki.article.role.renfield.guide: Select a player to kill them. You will become a thrall when another player is converted to a renfield. Make sure you dont choose the same player as dracula, because then you might kill a vampire.
wiki.article.role.renfield.abilities: * Visit a player to deal a basic attack to them
wiki.article.role.renfield.attributes: * If another player is converted to a renfield, you will become a thrall, so there will never be more than one renfield
wiki.article.role.renfield.extra: * You can not target other vampires
wiki.article.role.martyr.guide: Lead the people to paradise. To win, sacrifice yourself by dying.
wiki.article.role.martyr.abilities:
* Visit yourself to basic attack yourself and use one bullet
* You start with 5 bullets
* When you die, everyone else commits suicide and you win.
wiki.article.role.martyr.attributes:
- When you have zero bullets left, you will leave town and lose.
- You have a basic attack
wiki.article.role.martyr.extra: - If you visit a player while you have zero bullets left you will not attack them
